profileText: A Delegate and a Senator from Michigan; born in Norwich, Conn., August 20, 1780; studied law; moved to Ohio in 1799; admitted to the Ohio bar in 1806 and commenced the practice of law in Marietta; member, State house of representatives 1807; prosecuting attorney for New London (now Washington) County, Ohio, 1808-1814; member, State senate 1808-1814; moved to Detroit, Mich.; collector of customs, Michigan Territory 1814-1829; appointed secretary of Michigan Territory in 1814, and served until appointed judge of the Territory in 1828; elected as a Delegate to the Sixteenth Congress and served from March 4, 1819, to August 9, 1820, when he resigned; judge of the supreme court of Michigan Territory 1828-1832; delegate to the State constitutional convention 1835; member, State senate 1838-1839; Governor of Michigan 1840-1841; elected as a Whig to the United States Senate and served from March 4, 1841, to March 3, 1847; was not a candidate for reelection; chairman, Committee on Public Lands (Twenty-eighth Congress), Committee on Patents and the Patent Office (Twenty-ninth Congress); retired from public life and devoted his time to horticulture; died in Detroit, Mich., October 20, 1861; interment in Elmwood Cemetery.

creativeWork.freeFormCitationText: Lanman, Charles. The Life of William Woodbridge. Washington: Blanchard & Mohun, 1867.

researchRecord.name: 1810-1860. 58 items. Correspondence, and business and political papers.
1763-1919. 94 boxes, 36 volumes. Correspondence on legal and business affairs, speeches, writings, account books, cashbooks, and ledgers.
Correspondence in Robert Eliot and Norman Emmons papers, 1840-1882.

recordLocation.name: Milwaukee Area Research Center University of Wisconsin

researchRecord.name: Correspondence in Allen family papers, 1824-1867; Peter Barbeau papers, 1789-1909, on 8 microfilm reels of originals in Carnegie Library, Sault Sainte Marie; Lucy E. Chapin papers, 1834-1910; David Mack Cooper papers, [ca. 1812-ca. 1908]; Alpheus Felch papers, 1817-1896; William Sumner Maynard papers, 1836-1857; Michigan Central Railroad Company records, 1837-1921; Charles Irish Walker papers, 1817-1887; John Winder papers, 1825-1834; Francis Willett Shearman papers, 1839-1878; and Woodbridge family papers, 1841-1883.
Correspondence in Edward Tiffin papers, 1785-1853. Finding aid.
